description: Adrenaline-laced arousal: fear/threat present, but valence remains non-negative—danger registers as exciting rather than purely aversive.
actor_description: My pulse is loud. The danger is real—I can feel it in my chest—but it doesn't dampen the heat. It sharpens it. Fear and excitement braid together until I can't tell which one is driving my breath. Part of me wants to back away; part of me wants to lean in and taste the edge of it.
description_text: {actor}'s breath comes quick, eyes bright with a confusing mix of alarm and excitement; their body holds tense readiness, but there's a telling spark of enjoyment in the expression.

alternate_descriptions.auditory: I hear a shaky, breathy laugh—or a sharp inhale—that sounds like fear turning into exhilaration.
alternate_descriptions.tactile: The air around someone feels charged, like nervous energy and heat are rising off their skin at once.
